title: Government Transparency Through Technology

author: Matej Kovačič, CT3 Centre for Knowledge Transfer in Information Technologies, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: OK, my presentation will be about.
Web application supervision which was developed by the Commission for the Prevention of Corruption, where I have been employed till two months ago.
As I said, supervisor is online application which enables simple browsing through financial transactions and the graphical presentation of financial transactions of the whole Slovenian public sector.
Actually, all the budget users which means ministries over government institutions or municipalities and so on.
Users can view all monitors first from the selected budget user to the other budget users or to the companies.
And also user can see transactions details of all transactions or 2000 euros.
Both.
Public right?
Yeah yeah, yes, and there is no registration required so you just go I'll show this a little bit later.
You just go into Internet and you have all the data there and also data are published in machine readable form for download.
Not all data because some data.
Are being sold or commercially available.
I will explain this a little bit later so.
Or also there are included data about public procurements.
Management and ownership structure of the companies.
Some information from their annual reports was that useful.
I will show a little bit later.
One model is very important model which presents a list of public owned companies and information about them.
This is.
Looks very, very something very simple, but in fact it's not 'cause in Republic of Slovenia.
Actually there is no one list of public owned companies.
Actually there are three different lists.
One is published by the Ministry of Finance, One is published by by Ministry of Economics and 3rd by some other institution and they do not overlap.
So some companies are just on one.
List some companies are not on the other and so on.
So actually what we have done is we made analysis analysis of the data and presenting this information on the Internet.
Also supervisor displays accounting interests of payments for budget users and some additional data, for instance date about tax, debtors, Witcher.
Public published on the tax administrators administrating office and data transfers to tax havens, which are also published on the Internet at the website of Office for Money Laundering Prevention.
So.
We look a little bit more into the datasets.
So actually all the data.
From 2003 or more, the 1st and most important data set is the date about financial transactions and these are these are all financial transactions of budget users.
The second is Slovenian Business Register the Register of Legal entities, Bank accounts, the type of bank account and so on.
And public posting of companies annual reports.
This data are also available through public access.
Access to Public Information Act.
The next databases database of securities.
This data is not.
This is commercially available, so it's not available for download on the Internet.
And there are some other like register of taxpayers, register budget users, database of public procurements with all the text of public procurements then accounting entries of payments.
And as I mentioned, 8 about tax debtors and transactions to text counts.
This is how the application looks like.
Maybe I can show?
This with the.
On the Internet.
Um?
For instance, here you can see all the transactions from the Commission for the Prevention of Corruption to this company.
This is timeline.
Monthly monthly amount of transactions and there are some events.
These events are regarding to company like change of the direct or change of the owner and so on.
And these events are.
Events about the budget.
Budget user like change of the head of the budget, user and so on.
Then you can see.
The purpose the purpose of the transactions.
For instance, this is for electricity.
This is for West and so on, and this is from the database of accounting interest.
And then you also can see the details of transactions for 2000 euros for instance.
Or that date?
That amount of money was paid to this company to the transaction to this account and.
This was accounted for cleaning services and so on.
So basically you have all the data online and you can do some interesting analysis.
Another thing for company.
Of course you can search just for transactions for.
From one public institution actually budget user to all the companies or just to a specific company.
And also.
And also.
For instance, here you can see.
How much money went from this budget user to different to different companies?
Or you can just see how much money from the different different budget users received one specific company and also their subsidiaries.
Here you can.
You can select just a company or all the subsidiaries and there are also some other events.
This green green lines are the public procurements and these black lines are transactions to tax havens.
Since this is.
Telecom National telecom.
Of course they need to make business with companies with telecom syntax heaven so you can see how much money they paid for in two.
Their accounts and there is also a graphical representation of of management.
So.
Management boards and so on so you can see all the.
All the people.
We talked in charge of that company also you have public procurements and you can click on public procurement and you get the whole text of the public procurement which was published at.
At that time.
Another interesting statistics is.
Dependence from public sector for each company, there are strict it data from any reports.
Especially net revenue from sales and then we computed from the database of public sector payments.
All the transfers from the government.
And then you have estimated radio ratio.
How much money does the company received from the public from the budget users and in some cases some companies are receiving more than 90% just from one or two ministries and this is.
High corruption risk.
So this is.
This was also one analysis done and show shown some interesting.
Adults.
So another thing, now, when you have this database and it's it's online, then you can do some interesting analysis and I will show you just three examples of what can be done.
One is analysis of financial.
Other sections.
The aim was to detect if there is a link between individual governments and payments to particular companies, and I will show your graph.
It was very simple analysis.
First we try to detect companies which were receiving payments.
In when one government was in charge and then when there was the change of the government from left wing to right wing and then back to left wing, how the change reflected in.
Payments and you can clearly see.
This from this picture that you can.
This was actually done with Postgres database, just one select and and this companies came out and of course.
There is another picture.
Anne.

Companies which were not receiving any any business from the government until the government changes and then they received started to receive money and after the government changed they they were out of business almost completely we all.
So we have done some analysis.
How how is changed?
What is the influence of the change of the director?
It's not really research, we just did some quick research and it was found out that the director is very important.
For instance, one person is director of Company and then this director moves to the other company and that company stops doing business and this new company starts doing business with government.
And one funny case was when the first company was selling.
So concrete and the second one was selling some alcoholic drinks.
Yeah, yeah.
May
This this one graph is more interesting.
These are payments to all at companies actually in business registry there is 1 field which says which is the area, the activity of the main activity of the company.
So we select it.
All the companies which had activities like selling hardware, selling software, computer programming and so on.
And then we draw this graph of payments to these companies.
And as you can see, each December when budget users have too much money, they need to to use the money so they spend it for buying some computers, which of course they they.
They need them badly.

And you can see this anomaly here, and that's why 'cause if the budget users won't wouldn't spend the money, they would need to receive to pay the back to the central budget so so they spend it for some computers or something.
You can see it here.
Another little bit interesting or more serious analysis was the detection of business restriction of business activities.
Basically the integrity and prevention of Corruption Act Act restricts business activities between public sector body and private company in which the official holds the office.
And in private company he he is for instance manager or his family members of our managers or he has found their threats and so on.
Basically the public institutions need to report this restrictions to the CPC, but often they fail to do so.
So basically we linked the database of distractions.
And also linked the.
Business registry.
With the data from the Business register of the.
Of the budget users with the data in the business registry of the private companies and it was found out that in.
68 cases there were violations and the sum value of this illegal business was about 1.4 million euro.
And year later we repeated analysis and no violations were found.
So basically.
We did analysis.
There were some some legal actions against that, that public institutions and year later they find out.
OK, this is not going to work anymore and they stop doing this type of relation.
And the last thing I would like to show is the analysis of dependence from public sector.
We used just the.
We did analysis only on the biggest party companies.
We calculate the share of their profit coming from the budget users only and data has shown relatively high dependence of some of the bigger static companies from the income from the public sector.
24 of them have earned more than 90% of their net profit from budget users.
Tony.
This was considered of course also a significant corruption risk.
So I will stop here.
And questions.
